Specific Details: The European Parliament is discussing changes to the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Directive. Among the changes being discussed is the removal of the exemption for applying certain due-diligence requirements for low-value e-money products. We are requesting the support of the extension of the exemption to apply due-diligence procedures to low-value e-money products.
DPOs Lobbied: Billy Kelleher|MEP|European Parliament::Deirdre Clune|MEP|European Parliament::Garret Ahearn|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: The European Parliament is discussing changes to the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Directive. Among the changes being discussed is the removal of the exemption for applying certain due-diligence requirements for low-value e-money products. We are requesting the support of the extension of the exemption to apply due-diligence procedures to low-value e-money products.
Intended Results: Maintaining and extending the exemption to apply due-diligence procedures to low-value e-money products
